CatDescriptText: Mrs. Robert Platt, housewife, 1813 Webster Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "I don't approve of children of any age smoking because this is not a good habit. However, I'm not opposed to grown ups having the habit."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Robert Platt wearing pleated hat and light colored felted coat with top button fastened, standing in front of stone building with store window on left
